snippet: The New York Times sportswriter who covered the Mets in 1962, their first season, recalls the cast of characters who gathered in St. Petersburg, Fla., for spring training.
abstract: Sportswriter Robert Lipsyte essay recalls covering the New York Mets spring training during their inaugural 1962 season.

headline.main: Spring of ’62: Revisiting the Dawn of the Mets
headline.print_headline: Spring of ’62: Revisiting the Dawn of the Mets

snippet: The pair of deals to split EMI between Sony and Universal would give those music companies substantial advantages over Warner, the only other major player still in the market.
abstract: Pair of pending deals to split EMI between Sony and Universal will give those music companies substantial advantages over Warner, the only other major player still in the market; deals are subject to approval by regulatory agencies in the United States, in Europe and elsewhere, and are spurring scrutiny and criticism.

headline.main: Deals to Split EMI Spur Scrutiny and Criticism
headline.print_headline: Deals to Split EMI Spur Scrutiny and Criticism

snippet: One of the biggest suppliers for Apple, Dell, Hewlett-Packard and other electronics companies said salaries for many workers would immediately jump by 16 to 25 percent.
abstract: One of the biggest suppliers for Apple, Dell, Hewlett-Packard and other electronics companies said salaries for many workers would immediately jump by 16 to 25 percent.

headline.main: Foxconn Plans to Lift Pay Sharply at Factories in China

snippet: Officials with the Federal Trade Commission’s mobile unit warn that companies should build security into their products from the outset, not after a privacy debacle. Regulation might otherwise hit the commission’s agenda.
abstract: Officials with the Federal Trade Commission’s mobile unit warn that companies should build security into their products from the outset, not after a privacy debacle. Regulation might otherwise hit the commission’s agenda.

headline.main: Disruptions: And the Privacy Gaps Just Keep On Coming
headline.print_headline: Disruptions: And the Privacy Gaps Just Keep On Coming

snippet: One of the biggest suppliers for Apple, Dell, Hewlett-Packard and other electronics companies said salaries for many workers would immediately jump by 16 to 25 percent.
abstract: Foxconn Technology, one of the biggest manufacturers of products for Apple, Dell, Hewlett-Packard and other electronics companies, says that it will sharply raise worker salaries at its Chinese factories.

headline.main: Foxconn Plans to Lift Pay Sharply at Factories in China
headline.print_headline: Foxconn Plans To Sharply Lift Workers’ Pay

snippet: A number of apps will help keep smartphone owners from losing their phones, or the digital secrets they have stored on them.
abstract: App City column notes several security applications for smartphones.

snippet: Well-off Brazilians are flocking to New York, where they are snapping up expensive apartments. And in Miami, they are propping up a moribund market.
abstract: Big Deal column; well-off Brazilians are flocking to New York City, where they are quietly becoming steady clients for higher-end real estate brokers in Manhattan.

snippet: SAN FRANCISCO -- Another week. Another privacy debacle.     This time, Apple is to blame. Yes, the company that has promoted itself as more private and secure than the other guys, with its stringent app approval process, has actually been handing ...
abstract: Nick Bilton Disruptions column holds everyone is somewhat to blame for technology's privacy gaps; says current system of self-regulation is clearly not working; cites industry experts who say companies should build security into their products from the outset, not after a privacy debacle. (M)

headline.main: Disruptions: And the Privacy Gaps Just Keep On Coming

snippet: A LITTLE over a year ago, Maine Huts & Trails opened its newest backcountry eco-lodge in the mountains of western Vacationland. Each of the lodges, now numbering three, has hot showers and private guesthouses and serves breakfasts and dinners prep...
abstract: Eric Hansen travel article on a deep-winter, cross-country ski tour through the forests of Maine. Maps, Photos (L)9
